Job DescriptionMcKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by the CDC, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.McKesson Corporation is a Fortune 10 company and is one of the largest providers of healthcare supply chain management solutions, retail pharmacy, medical & pharmaceutical supplies, healthcare technology, community oncology and specialty care in the United States with revenues of $231 billion in 2020. The company was founded in 1833 by John McKesson and Charles Olcott in New York with a focus on importing and wholesaling pharmaceutical products. United by our ICARE shared principles, McKesson's 80,000 employees work together every day to make better care possible around the globe – one product, one partner, one patient at a time.Current Need:We are seeking a Senior Director to head our Advanced Data & Analytics Products team, as a part of the broader Advanced Analytics group within McKesson.Position DescriptionThe Head of Data and Analytics Products at McKesson will lead enterprise data strategy as well as the design, development and deployment of advanced analytics products across the organization. The leader will own our MLOps CI/CD/CT strategy for deploying machine learning solutions at scale for current and future capabilities. We are looking for a candidate that is passionate about building advanced ML, AI and Data products that ensure patients receive the medications they need, when they need them; improve quality of care for oncology patients; and exemplify operational excellence so that the business can focus on what matters most, value creation for our customers. This leader will also help scale data transformation efforts within McKesson, helping architect our data mesh along with ensuring robust data governance.McKesson’s Head of Data & Analytics Products will lead Machine Learning Engineering, Machine Learning Operations, AI Capabilities development as well as industrialization of Data Science solutions within the organization. This leader will partner closely with data science and advanced analytics teams, both within the centralized group as well as those embedded in business, to help build data and analytics products at scale.Head of Data & Analytics Products will manage our 3 key pillars i.e. Advanced Analytics Products including ML Engineering and ML Operations, Data Products (including 3rd party data & transformation focused on Data Mesh), as well as Data Governance. This will be a senior role on the broad data and digital innovation team, and will help in defining and developing our data commercialization capabilities. This team will work in collaboration with other business units and McKesson Technology to bring value to McKesson and the healthcare ecosystem, as well as better outcomes for patients.Head of Data & Analytics products will guide senior leadership and cross-functional executives in relevant issues and will represent the department more broadly at the enterprise level. Key ResponsibilitiesCreate and lead execution of our MLOps CI/CD/CT strategy to standardize batch and streaming training and serving of ML Web apps and APIs.Create the roadmap for our next generation data science workbench integrated with our new data meshRecruit top talent machine learning engineers to join this team. Drive adoption of best-in-class capabilities, including Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing and Next Best Action Recommenders.Build, scale, deploy, and manage data science solutions in a multi-cloud environment to provide predictive insights that further McKesson’s mission to improve care in every setting.Lead the strategy, design and delivery of best-in-class data products, leveraging advanced techniques including but not limited to data meshAt an enterprise level, help lead the data governance efforts within McKesson, partnering closely with the senior leadership and partnering with a strong data governance teamScale delivery of advanced data and analytics projects by ensuring timeliness and quality of standardized products, that are robust both in terms of architecture as well as insightsCommunicate strategy and results to technical and non-technical audiences; Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, partners, and internal clients.Direct machine learning engineers, as well as data product and governance teams; Provide analytics leadership; Conduct weekly methodology/code reviews; Utilize industry and academic resources to continuously learn, innovate, and contribute to a growing knowledge base of data science best practices.Collaborate with multi-disciplinary team members (data scientists, data engineers and business analysts); Manage business stakeholder relationships to drive action and value from data science insightsPartner with digital accelerators, universities, and consultants to accelerate innovation; Opportunities to co-author peer-reviewed publications and patent your AI/ML innovationsUnderstand McKesson’s complex and diverse data environment to design data strategy for use in machine learning models; Analyze complex health, business transaction, and supply chain datasetsSolve problems from the business point of view, build and execute solid analytics work plans, gather and organize large and complex data assets, perform relevant analyses (data exploration and statistical modeling), automate work streams, foster teamwork in interactions, develop client relationships with business stakeholders, and communicate hypotheses and findings in a structured way.Minimum RequirementsTypically has 15+ years of relevant experienceCritical Skills12 years of relevant experience in data science and/or machine learning and data system design & governance with a proven record around delivery is required.5yr management and mentorship experience with machine learning engineers/data scientists in business or scientific research settings.Expert experience in one or more programming languages, Python plus Java, C/C++, …Expert experience with MLOps, CI/CD/CT, scalable ML deployment (e.g. MLFlow, Kubeflow, Docker, Kubernetes)Expert experience with cloud computing in Azure or GCPExperience with distributed computing: (e.g. Databricks, Apache Spark, Hadoop…)Experience with data pipelines, streaming architecture (Kafka), data engineering, creating feature stores, processing unstructured and structured data at scale.Industry experience using TensorFlow and Pytorch to develop Representation Machine Learning Systems; e.g. Next-Best-Action, Recommendation systems; Deep Learning Neural Networks; Image understanding; Document classification and keyword extractionAdditional Knowledge & Skills:Industry experience in Healthcare or Supply Chain, including project and budget managementExperience in core data science and predictive analytics methods: Statistics (t-tests, Poisson process), Segmentation and clustering techniques, predictive modeling: e.g. regression, classification, Time Series analysis: e.g. ARIMA, Traditional machine learning methods: e.g. Random Forest, ensemble model techniques, Optimization: e.g. linear programmingExperience with Linux, shell scriptingExperience with Snowflake Data CloudFamiliarity with a data visualization tool: e.g. Tableau, Power BIExperience with Reinforcement Learning for inventory optimization and marketingEducation:Bachelors or higher with relevant experience in machine learning; and data architecture and design is required. The degree should be in computer science, applied mathematics, operation research or machine learning.Physical Requirements:General Office Demands
